intro: Dichanthelium caparaoense, commonly known as the Caparaó grass, is a species of grass native to Brazil. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
